mdRecord.dcterms:title: Hillwood Estate, Museum & Gardens, general view

mdRecord.dcterms:description: Lunar Lawn with "Leo," 18th-century stone lion sculpture

Marjorie Merriweather Post purchased the Arbremont estate in northwest Washington DC near Rock Creek Park in 1955, renamed it Hillwood, and had the interior rebuilt to showcase her collection of art objects. She bequeathed the estate to the Smithsonian upon her death. In 1976, three years after her death in 1973, the estate reverted to the Marjorie Merriweather Post Foundation of the District of Columbia, which maintains the museum. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hillwood_Estate,_Museum_%26_Gardens [work]
